title: Chane Behanan releases statement defending Pitino
text:

WHAS11.com: http://on.whas11.com/1RWomEF   Join the Conversation To   Chane Behanan releases statement defending Pitino Bethanni Williams, 12:48 p.m. EDT October 21, 2015 ATLANTA, GA - APRIL 06: Chane Behanan #21 of the Louisville Cardinals holds up five fingers for injured teammate Kevin Ware after the Cardinals defeat the Wichita State Shockers 72-68 during the 2013 NCAA Men's Final Four Semifinal at the Georgia Dome on April 6, 2013 in Atlanta, Georgia. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) (Photo: WHAS) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LOUISVILLE, Ky. (WHAS 11)--Montrezl Harrell tight lipped there but other former players not holding back in their reaction to Tuesday's developments. 
Former Cardinal Chane Behanan posted a statement defending Coach Rick Pitino saying : 
"And for those who think Coach Pitino had any involvement should get their brain checked by multiple doctors because it's something seriously wrong with you, Coach P preached good behavior and also how to treat others with the upmost respect."
